dialogues.text: You didn't mention he was cute. GALE is staring intently at BUBBER'S modest, humble face on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO IMAGE, (INT. TV STUDIO)
dialogues.text: The humble, honest face of BUBBER, freeze framed as GALE' VOICE narrates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --were shocked to learn that the hero who appeared out of the smoke and the fire and pulled them to safety was indigent and tragically hadn't slept in a bed in more than three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing BUBBER'S honest face on the TV screen in the day r enrages BERNIE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's a fake, for Chrissake! He's a goddamn homeless bum.  He ain't no here, trust me on this, buddy. PRISONERS, standing in a group under the TV turn from the to BERNIE, like "who's this asshole?"  A BIG PRISONER gla at BERNIE ominously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Trust you"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office has become command-central.  REPORTERS hurry i out, tearing off faxes, answering the phones, chattering other, GALE among them.  WALLACE is fretting to DEAKINS..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they'd all go "It's him! It's him!" and hug the guy or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Wally.  He had the shoe and the shoe checks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean I can stop worrying? Where'd we put him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drake Hotel, Penthouse Suite.  Never stop worrying.  I figure we'll do a sidebar on what it's like to go from sleeping in your car and collecting cans to sleeping in the poshest suite in town.  Also Gale's onto something, digging into his background. PARKER rushes up to GALE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Ms. Gayley.  That guy Inspector Dayton... he's recovered a bunch of your credit cards and he wants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector Dayton, the cop from Robbery Detail who was looking for you.  They caught the guy who stole your credit cards trying to sell them and he wants...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody stole my credit cards.  They burned up in the crash.  Which reminds me, did you get me cash? And what about the reservations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by the jailhouse cacophony, BERNIE stares glum plate of shit on a shingle in front of him while close at TOUGH PRISONER snarls at ANOTHER PRISONER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mess with me, I'm gonna cut yer heart out and eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAPTAIN finishes scribbling and seizes the menus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir.  It's a special privilege to serve you. BUBBER smiles uneasily as the haughty CAPTAIN glides away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, er... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused and charmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying you don't want a million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not entitled to a million dollars.  I... I... didn't expect... I didn't expect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the adulation?  It makes you feel like a fake, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, actually... yes... I... should never have come forward and presented myself as -- Just then a distinguished MILLIONAIRE on the way to his t barks gruffly at BUBBER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a credit to the goddamn human race.  Coulda been me in that plane. Or my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instant celebrity is overwhelming to anybody.  You've known John Bubber all your life, you're used to him, you know you're the same human being you were before all the excitement.  So you feel like a fraud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unworthy of the adoration.  We all do. A bluehaired MATRON, extravagantly bejeweled, pauses to l over BUBBER on her way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to donate a half million to charity in your name.  Would small animals be all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, "small animals"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (delighted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew a man like you would adore small animals.  God bless you, Mister Bubber. (to Gale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, my dear, you do so much for women. And then she's gone in a swish of silk, leaving BUBBER st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she... serious?  A half a million dollars?  In my behalf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a celebrity, John.  People are going to want to please you... or use you... or both. Bubber hears this, digests it, considers it.  He takes a of food, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door to the restaurant opens, BUBBER finds himself blinded by winking electronic flashes and sun guns.  A CR OF FANS and MEDIA engulf him and GALE.  It's overwhelming SEE EAGER FACES and BLINDING FLASHES from BUBBER'S P.O.V. HEAR the CACOPHONY OF QUESTIONS. GALE too is adrift in a churning sea of MEDIA and ONLOOKE POLICE OFFICERS move close to help guide GALE and BUBBER waiting limo. ANGLE ON BUBBER'S P.O.V. Again we see the chaos from BUBBER'S P.O.V., A POLICEMAN reaching to help him.  Just then BUBBER glimpses somethin else... beyond the CROWD in the fringes... HOMELESS PEOPL the shadows, some applauding him, too shy to come forward particular, BUBBER'S eyes fall on an ungainly MAN, his ow dressed in rags and carrying a big garbage bag and anothe sack full of cans.  IT'S A STUNNING IMAGE!  It's as thoug BUBBER is looking at himself! The door to the limo is open.  GALE and several POLICEMEN trying to get BUBBER into the limo and out of the clutche the enthusiastic CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, John. But BUBBER isn't paying attention to her.  He's turning t the eager CROWD, raising his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, uh, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: looking alarmed, then amazed. The CROWD is still alive and buzzing, but they're respect BUBBER'S space as he accepts an autograph book from a you woman, SYLVIA, and speaks shyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, uh, want me to sign this?  Uh, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak in the knees, smitten)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S-sylvia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost shy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if I sign this, will you do me a favor? Her COMPANIONS are already teasing her as they thrust pie paper, magazines at him to sign.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: watching in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: signing one after another as he addresses all those close him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'd like is... (addressing the group)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- maybe some of the rest of you could help Sylvia here -- what I'd like is if you'd scrounge up some blankets -- used ones, fifty maybe -- and take 'em to the folks down at the corner of Fifth and Grand. Pass 'em out. Cameras are rolling, GALE watches, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth and Grand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He means the homeless people.  The bums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets cold down there at night. And you'll feel warmer for every person you give a blanket to. GALE'S knits her brow, trying to reconcile this performan the apparent yokel she had dinner with a short time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER looks back at the CROWD as the limo pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet they do it.  I'll bet they get some blankets. GALE looks at BUBBER, reevaluating him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BUBBER and GALE cross the luxurious lobby, again the c of attention, a GORGEOUS BLONDE, very leggy, practically plasters her plunging neckline against BUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uplifting!  What you did was so uplifting!  You're a saint, John Bubber! BUBBER has trouble untangling his eyes from her tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no.  But I, uh, wonder if you could up support... support a program to help the needy and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hackles raised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I'm sure she could support just about anything. (steering him away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll see you to your room. A sort of bodyguard.  Make sure no harm comes to you. GALE ushers the dazed BUBBER toward a bank of elevators a prevents others from joining them in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALE'S mood changes to amusement as she and BUBBER ascend Giggling, she "points" her chest at BUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, if you could, just, uh, support, uh, a small airfield...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been sometime since, uh, I received any, uh, of that kind of, uh... attention.  A couple of... years. GALE stops giggling.  Their eyes meet.  A charged moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years? (then...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are going to be lots of... opportunities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale... you're a very nice person. I wouldn't want to hurt you... in any way... They're struggling against an embrace that seems inevitab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I know that, John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... you think I saved your... life.  I can't take advantage....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did save my life!  And it's me! I'd be taking advantage of you! I'm a reporter, John, an experienced professional...  I... Inevitably they embrace, KISS, can't help themselves. BUBBER disengages suddenly, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... no... I don't have the right... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't have the right.  You're a news story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, right.  A... news story. She pushes him out the elevator door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the truth, John.  I'm flying in some guys from your unit in Vietnam tomorrow.  Interviewing them live on network hookup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vietnam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER wanders into the bedroom of the fabulous suite... a daze.  He stares at BERNIE'S shoes on the floor.  He sh his head as if to clear it.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION SCREEN
dialogues.text: A fortyish black man, TOM WELLER, appears on the screen..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next thing I know, I'm in this medical unit an' I see the other dude, the one who was with me when we got jumped, the one who I thought was dead.  There he is in the next bed.  I says "How'd we get here, brother?  We dead or what?" He says, "That crazy white brother, Johnny Bubber, he come back for us, hauled us out."  He shoulda been wrote up, got a medal, but it was fate.  Wasn't no officers around to observe it or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION SCREEN
dialogues.text: A fortyish redneck type, CHARLIE BACON, is speaking to ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sonofagun goes out in the paddies, pulling us outta there, one after the other, six guys.  Hey, it don't surprise me one bit it was Johnny Bubber went into that plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks says the asshole was never even in Vietnam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE is furious, glaring at the TV, surrounded by PRISO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your face, dirt bag... That guy's a goddamn hero and you're nothin' but a cynical little turd.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN, (INT. TV STUDIO - DAY)
dialogues.text: BUBBER is embracing WELLER, CHARLIE and several other VET as GALE narrates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After an emotional reunion, Bubber's fellow veterans watched as station manager James Wallace presented Bubber with a check for one million dollars... Surrounded by applauding MEDIA TYPES, SPECTATORS and VETE BUBBER is accepting the check...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bubber reacted to his sudden wealth, word came that the Secretary of the Army, responding to an urgent resolution from the Senate has conferred on John Bubber the Medal of Honor. This for his actions in Vietnam more than 20 years ago, heroism that was not acknowledged at the time because it was not witnessed or reported by a ranking officer.  Later I spoke to him about his sudden change in circumstances... BUBBER appears full screen, head and shoulders, interview footage.  He's shy and awkward at first... tentative... t gaining confidence as he speaks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't feel... right... about all that money, Miss Gayley.  That's too much money for one person.  What I'm gonna do is donate, uh, most of it to different organizations like the Homeless Vets and stuff, and start up some programs... to help people.  See, when you're out there in the cold like I was, on the streets or sleeping under bridges or in your car, the worst thing, even worse than the hunger and the cold, is the...  feeling... that you're just plain...  useless. You don't matter to a single soul in this world, nobody needs you, nobody wants you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER'S INTERVIEW appears on screens in...

dialogues.speaker: -WHITE HOUSE
dialogues.text: The PRESIDENT watching.

dialogues.speaker: -SHADOW LOUNGE
dialogues.text: CHICK watching.

dialogues.speaker: -JAIL
dialogues.text: BERNIE watching.

dialogues.speaker: -EVELYN'S LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: JOEY, EVELYN, and ELLIOT watching.

dialogues.speaker: -PRISON
dialogues.text: INMATES, their tough faces momentarily solemn, watching.

dialogues.speaker: -WINSTON'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: WINSTON smacks the TV he bought from Bernie to adjust the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess when I... did what I did... I was trying to save my own life more than anything else. Trying to connect myself with people again and be... part of the whole.  You have to help others to do that, you need a role to, play... even if it's a very humble role, it gives you self worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NOTE:  Bubber dialogue, additional or as above continues throughout scene) GALE, her editor, JOAN, DEAKINS, WALLACE, CHUCKY, PARKER, CONKLIN are crowded around the monitor staring at the scr JOAN catches GALE surreptitiously hiding a tear and whisp to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he like that in real life?  So gorgeous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pretty... remarkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes widening at the thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't... get it on with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous.  I'm a reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters don't have hormones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters... have to... rise above their hormones.

dialogues.speaker: DEAKINS, WALLACE
dialogues.text: reacting to BUBBER on TV.  WALLACE is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's... a natural. DEAKINS rolls his eyes, a cynical, hardened newsman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked John Bubber about the Medal of Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as the medal goes, well... that medal's for something me and my buddies did almost twenty years ago in Viet Nam.  So if I'm a war hero today then I was a war hero last week when I was selling cans and sleeping in my car... when I didn't have a medal.  I don't think a medal makes a hero.  You don't need machinegun fire or burning planes to be... brave.  People do heroic acts every day only there's nobody around to take their picture or decorate them.  Little things can be heroic.  Helping someone day in and day out, giving up your life a little every day instead of all at once... to help. Maybe... maybe we're all heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the nation solemn FACES reflect the glow of the TV YOUNG FACES, OLD FACES, BLACK, WHITE, BROWN, YELLOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And BERNIE LAPLANTE'S FACE.  He's glaring at the scree the Day Room of the Jail, sputtering helplessly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all heroes, huh?  Asshole! Just then a GUARD enters the Day Room and belows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya made bail, Ace.  C'mon, let's go. BERNIE looks startled.

dialogues.speaker: WELLESIAN VIDEO
dialogues.text: News coverage of the crash and photos of Bubber are ZOOME DISSOLVED, WHIRLED and SPUN into a glittering promo while stentorian WELLESIAN VOICE brays excitedly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Bubber himself!  Along with twenty of the real survivors of flight 104!  See the real life participants re-enact the terrifying drama inside the burning plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER is staring at the TV screen wide-eyed with amazeme as the promo continues on the screen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the darkness, out of the fire, out of a nightmare of fear... came The Angel of Flight 104.  John Bubber saved fifty-four people.  This is his story and theirs.  A drama featuring the actual people who actually lived those moments of terror.  No make-up, no music, no actors. This is the real thing.  Thursday night.  Channel-Four.  Be there! On Screen the Channel Four logo blends exotically with "T Image".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dismayed BUBBER dials the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAKINS and WALLACE walk, deep in conversation, WALLACE u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upset!  What's he upset about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he's not an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not supposed to be an actor, that's the whole point.  He's a real life hero, all he has to do is act like a real life hero.  That's the beauty of the concept, the whole freshness of it.  Did she call him back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's talking to him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We paid him a million dollars. You'd think he'd want to cooperate a little, help our ratings. DEAKINS responds eagerly to GALE entering the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll do it. (to Wallace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really-should have talked to him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might have said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE charging through the crowded Waiting Room having j been released on bail.  He doesn't actually shove the WOM CHILDREN waiting to visit inmates out of the way, but he slow down either as he weaves rapidly among them with DON his heels, barely able to keep pace.  He doesn't look bac he speaks rapid-fire.  He's really pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddaya mean they didn't reduce the bail?  If they didn't reduce it, how'dja spring me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a deep breath, embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took a loan on my car and my computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (actually stops, faces her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You whaaaaaat?  You paid it?  You gave a bondsman ten percent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was inspired by the hero, how he stuck his neck out for others, how he took a chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apoplectic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fake inspired you to loan a guy who's been fired off his job twenty-five hundred goddamn dollars? A guy you say is probably gonna do time!  You're s'posed to be an attorney for Chrissake!  You're s'posed to have good judgment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as you like to point out, Mister LaPlante, I'm relatively inexperienced.  My naivete may have worked to your benefit in this instance. BERNIE frowns at that, starts walking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're right, I'm glad you got me out, I appreciate that. BERNIE charges out the door, exiting the building with DO right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurrying down the steps, BERNIE barks over his shoulder a DONNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, now that I owe you twenty-five hundred bucks plus, how about loaning me twenty for cab fare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can call me "naive," Mister LaPlante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you could call me "Bernie," forget the "Mister LaPlante" stuff. (seeing Donna open her wallet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are naive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the probation report.  It's not good.  I think you're going... going to prison, Mister... Bernie. I know that scares you but..

dialogues.speaker: TAXI
dialogues.text: (turning on her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least I'm gonna get my goddamn million bucks. (screaming at a cab)

dialogues.speaker: TAXI FOR CHRISSAKE
dialogues.text: A cab pulls to the curb and BERNIE jumps in, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen on the TV where that do-gooder asshole's gonna go visit sick kids at three-thirty. (to the Cabbie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children's Hospital, on the double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean John Bubber? BERNIE speaks out the window of the cab as it pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (then, through the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bozo don't just owe me a million bucks for my shoe, he's a goddamn menace!  Look what he done to you!  He's makin' people insane. He's a whacko, he' gotta be stopped. Stunned, DONNA watches the cab disappear in traffic with raving from the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limos are parked out front of the hospital and there is a gathering of TV vans as BERNIE exits a cab and charges to the entrance of the hospital, a tiny figure dwarfed by th building.  He disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We discover BERNIE wandering around, lost.  A NURSE gives a glance in passing and BERNIE suddenly is aware that his appearance is unusual.  Disheveled.  Unshaven.  He tries smooth his hair a little as he turns into a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping through the door BERNIE is immediately horror st Rows of beds.  A room full of seriously SICK CHILDREN.  P Eyes out of sync.  Motor disorders, spasms.  Terrifying paraphenalia...  tubes, machines, monitors, bags of fluid place of sUffering.  To BERNIE it's a vision of a leper c A SEVEN YEAR OLD spots him, clutches at him with clawlike jerky movements. BERNIE recoils in horror, backing away. A FIVE YEAR OLD, "blinded" by the gauze wrapped around hi "looks" toward BERNIE and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that him?  Is he here yet, Miss Roberts? An EIGHT YEAR OLD with a bandaged arm responds, looking a BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, it's just some guy. A nurse MISS ROBERTS, appears from behind a curtain sudde and restrains the SEVEN YEAR OLD as she addresses BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir.  Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, well I... what I... Looks "wrong," acts "wrong."  Looks like a child molester

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to leave, ,sir.  This ward is off limits.  If you want to arrange a visit... Just then a couple of CAMERAMEN back through the door sho It's the head end of an entourage of REPORTERS, CAMERAMEN HOSPITAL PERSONNEL and a couple of SECURITY GUYS that are traveling with BUBBER. BERNIE is bumped backward by a CAMERAMAN just as he sees enter surrounded by MEDIA PEOPLE. BERNIE'S P.O.V. seeing BUBBER unhesitatingly reach out to the grotesque S YEAR OLD and lift him into is arms, eyes shining with war smiling genuinely like he likes picking up hideous lookin

dialogues.speaker: MISS ROBERTS
dialogues.text: tapping one of the SECURITY OFFICERS on the shoulder and indicating BERNIE to him.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: remembering why he's here.  It's not going to be as easy thought.  He starts to move through the entourage looking out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, pal.  Uh, couldja lemmee through here?  Thanks I... THE SECURITY OFFICER is suddenly between BERNIE and his destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta press pass, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press pass?  Uh, hey, I lost it. Listen...

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: holding the SEVEN YEAR OLD.  Smiling broadly, the child r joy in the warmth of BUBBER'S embrace, his grotesqueness miraculously minimized by his mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (O.S., diminishing)

dialogues.speaker: I WANNA DO IS TALK TO THE GUY.
dialogues.text: BUBBER and everybody turn toward the sound of the commoti BUBBER'S P.O.V. of an unidentified MAN (BERNIE), obscured by the bodies o two SECURITY OFFICERS who are hurriedly hustling him off ward.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: is frowning when a DOCTOR reassures him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All under control.  An unfortunate man.  Security will look after him. BUBBER nods and turns back to SICK KIDS who seem transfig from BERNIE'S gruesome vision to children radiant with ho Much of their appearance, at least, was attitude, despair

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: A solitary figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 14 year old ALLEN lies comatose in an intensive care ro tubes in his nose, arms, and chest, monitors all around h arms and legs in casts and traction. BUBBER leans over the unconscious boy speaking intensely DOCTOR hovers next to him and REPORTERS and CAMERAMEN joc position at the foot of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, kid, you gotta hang on. I know you're scared, we all get scared, but that's when you have to fight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid he can't hear you.  He...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can hear me... As he leans closer to ALLEN, BUBBER puts a hand out witho turning away from the boy,and waves away CHUCKY who has o in close with his camera.  This is private.  Understandin puts a hand on the lens and pushes the camera aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... (eyes flicking to Allen's I.D. bracelet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen, you're in the darkness there and it's scary.  The doctors are working on you but the tough part is for you.  You can't quit! GALE can't hear what BUBBER is saying as he leans even cl to ALLEN and grips the boy's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't know it, but you're a hero.  Sometimes you don't know how brave you are... and sometimes you don't know... you can do something...  until you... until you surprise yourself and... do it.  But I know you've got the stuff, I know it in my heart.  I want you to struggle kid... for yourself, for all of us. (vulnerable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me.  I... I really need you to do this for me.  I need you to get well, Allen. Did an eyelid flicker?  Did the boy hear? GALE'S eyes glisten with emotion as BUBBER rises, shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CROWD is waiting for BUBBER, MEDIA PERSONNEL among them BERNIE comes up behind a TV CAMERAMAN and taps his should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, you're with the media, right?  I got a story for you. Something fantastic.  That guy Bubber, he's a fake, he... THE CAMERAMAN is turning to consider BERNIE when there's sudden EXCITEMENT.  The CROWD surges toward the hospital entrance.  VOICES cry out "He's coming!  Here he comes!" THE CAMERAMAN turns toward the doors leaving BERNIE helpl caught in a surging tide of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER and his entourage of DOCTORS, MEDIA PEOPLE and SEC GUARDS are surging toward the front door of the hospital an excited amoeba.  GALE is close to BUBBER in the crush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were... very... inspiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A script!  I thought we just walked through everything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it.  It'll be fine. They're being swept through the front door of the hospita whole amoeba.  A CHEER GOES UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE is being tossed about like a cork in stormy seas. Buffeted about by happy ONLOOKERS full of good will, only is surly, obnoxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit shovin', lady.  Hey, watch yer elbow.  YOU'RE ALL NUTS FOR CRYING

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: being jostled as his BODYGUARDS are shoved back into him, CAMERAS push toward his face, HANDS reach out desperately him.  But, in a dramatic contrast to BERNIE, BUBBER thriv the energy, laughing, reaching out to touch the hands tha for him, thriving on the vibe.

dialogues.speaker: YA GODDAMN PHONY
dialogues.text: BUBBER stiffens imperceptibly.  Dld he hear that right? there a discordant note in the cacophony' of VOICES singi praises from every direction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of shining faces filled with love and admiration su in front of him.  And yet, that VOICE again, a sour note contraction...

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: Hearing it, looking around urgently, but all he sees are ADMIRERS thrusting at him as he's borne, as if on a tide, his limo.  Nobody else seems to have noticed BERNIE'S VOI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door slams shut, the cheering is suddenly faint. sinks back in the opulent seats while FACES distort thems against the smoked glass, trying to peer into the sanctua Then, as the limo pulls away, BUBBER hears the VOICE agai muffled by the thick glass.  He turns, looks out the rear window.  He sees the CROWD receding behind him, a confusi SPECTATORS and... is that that hitchhiker (BERNIE) being restrained by a COP?

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: Shaken and frowning with concern, he turns away from the now out of view behind the moving limo. Alone in the luxurious leathered sanctuary, he realizes h hands are shaking as he reaches for the manila envelope G him and tears it open. He stares at the script titled THE ANGEL OF FLIGHT 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the happy CROWD disperses, an enraged BERNIE is facing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what I can and can't say.  This is America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, suit yourself, buddy.  If it makes you feel better to insult a man who's worth about a thousand of you, go ahead.  Like he says, "We're all heroes," pal.  Even you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!  What a lotta bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, have it your own way: you're not a hero.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: blinking, as the T-shirts magically feature BUBBER again, smiling, heroic.  BERNIE wonders if this is hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the deserted bar, CHICK looks from the TV set as B enters, weary and bedraggled, the strut gone.  Bernie hol his hands defensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't blame you for bein' sore.  I know I screwed up gettin' busted in here.  You got a right to throw me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna throw you out, Bernie. CHICK is fixing a seven and seven.  He puts it on the bar BERNIE hesitates, then steps to the bar, takes a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Chick.  I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors who had believed the boy had little or no chance for survival, now predict a slow but complete recovery. CHICK glances up at the TV screen and BERNIE looks too.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV SCREEN, (INT. WARD/HOSPITAL - DAY)
dialogues.text: news footage shows young ALLEN in his hospital bed, still engulfed in tubes and life support equipment, but conscio smiling bravely for the CAMERA while a REPORTER narrates.

dialogues.speaker: CHICK
dialogues.text: eyes on the TV, shaking his head in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva guy, ain't he?  Vietnam, plane crash, now miracles. BERNIE stares at the screen lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign over the door says "STAGE ONE/CHANNEL 4." Further on the door itself a sign says "NO ADMITTANCE/ AUTHORIZED

dialogues.speaker: PERSONNEL ONLY"
dialogues.text: UNIFORMED POLICE linger around the door, surrounded by FA BUBBER'S limo waits at the curb, his DRIVER lounging by t door. DAYTON (we saw him earlier in the courtroom), is making h through the knot of ONLOOKERS and MEDIA PERSONNEL gathere around the limo and in front of the entrance. Approaching as if to enter, he is confronted by one of th several UNIFORMED POLICEMEN guarding the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir.  Closed to the public.. (Dayton is reaching for his fold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No media either, sir, they're taping a show and... Oh, right.  Sorry about that, Inspector. DAYTON is flashing his badge fold as the POLICEMAN hastil the door for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAYTON enters the sound stage and sees the mock-up bathed hot light in the middle of the darkened stage, surrounded shadowy cameras and TECHNICIANS.  The SURVIVORS are visib the skeletal plane, rehearsing. DAYTON settles in the shadows, out of earShot, watching.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: Approaching GALE who's lying "helplessly" among the seats looms over her, his face obscured by "mud" make-up, hesit She whispers helpfully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you lean down and free me from the seat.  I was caught and... that's it.  Good. BUBBER bends down, starts to "free" her, a troubled look face.  He is struggling with something emotionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you help me up.  Boy, you seem...  taller.  It must be psychological...  now that I know you saved my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale!  I can't go through with this! It's... it's all wrong!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing fine.  You didn't actually lift me though.  It was more like you supported me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (supporting her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, like that.  Kind of, uh, sexy. (with meaning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can support me anytime, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just remembered.  You were talking about bodybuilding and swearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bodybuilding! THE DIRECTOR'S VOICE booms over the speaker from the boot

dialogues.speaker: THING...
dialogues.text: (a beat, then...)

dialogues.speaker: BETTER" ON THE SCREEN.
dialogues.text: (then, to all of them...)

dialogues.speaker: DAYTON
dialogues.text: Watching, impassive.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: Lifting GALE, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not right, Gale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misunderstanding again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no big deal, it just looks better carrying me.  Oh, you mean because I wasn't carrying my purse at the time. GALE has a purse under one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly serious, eye contact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an inspiration, John.  You're making us better human beings.  Less cynical.  More open, more giving. Do you realize that? BUBBER starts to say something again, but the moment for confession has passed, they're approaching LESLIE who is applauding along with the other SURVIVORS, tears in her e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave her here... and you (sob) go back in again. BUBBER nods and starts grimly back up the slope, trapped heroic role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE is sitting moodily at the bar while CHICK washes g and the TV DRONES.  BERNIE is wrestling with a thought. breaks the, silence finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What wouldja say if I toldja I ran into a burning plane an' saved a buncha people, Chick, an' risked my goddamnlife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like Bubber?  The hero?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like that.  Same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I mean... what am I supposed to say here, Bern?  Is this a riddle or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, if I said it, wouldja believe me? (then...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya wouldn't, would ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a character thing, Bernie. I mean, you wouldn't do it.  No offense.  Me neither.  I mean, a guy like Bubber, he's a certain kinda guy.  Heroic.  You and me, we're not... heroic.  It's not our nature. It don't mean we're bad or nothing. We're just not so inclined.  What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be depressed about it, Bern.  A guy don't have to be heroic to be a human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thing is, Chick.  I'm goin' down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down.  You mean jail?  For that credit card stuff?  For Chrissake, Bernie, your lawyer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not jail.  Prison.  And not that credit card bullshit, that's nothin'.  I got a conviction. Sentencing tomorrow.  Some cases of paint I got involved with. Latex.  I see this parole officer, he writes a report to the judge says I'm "anti-social."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Anti-social."  Jesus, Bernie. How much paint are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAYTON unnoticed among the shadows, as the YOUTHFUL DIREC addresses the assembled SURVIVORS.  DAYTON focuses on GAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a wrap, guys.  I want to thank you all.  I think we did something very important here this evening. BUBBER is looking for GALE, spots her fifteen yards away.

dialogues.speaker: A BLACK MAN
dialogues.text: is showing GALE something, a badge fold, saying something her.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: reacting.  A frown.  he starts to move toward them but a ARTIST approaches him insistently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me get that gunk off your face, Mister Bubber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it can wait, I... His eyes on GALE and DAYTON, BUBBER is disengaging from t MAKE-UP ARTIST when SUSAN suddenly blocks his way, holdin a DOLL, a shy KELLY in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Bubber... uh, John... Kelly wants you to sign an autograph for John Jr. BUBBER finds himself facing a JOHN BUBBER DOLL, sees KELL peering up at him hopefully.  What can he do?  He's a pat

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: as DAYTON speaks to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't take more than ten minutes. Fifteen at the most.  I'll buy you, a cuppa coffee down the street.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: Handing the autograph to KELLY and looking toward the spo GALE was.

dialogues.speaker: DAYTON AND GALE
dialogues.text: walking toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: calling out, starting after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale! Just then SMITH rushes up to him, blocking his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I breathe, I see the sun, I thank you.  God bless you.  I'm alive because of you, every moment of life I owe to you. BUBBER looks at his grateful face.  What can he say?  He toward the exit. BUBBER'S P.O.V. GALE and DAYTON have disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: eyes full of despair as other grateful PASSENGERS engulf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credit Cards are spread out on the formica table top in t booth where GALE and DAYTON face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How... how does this, whatsisname, the "sleazebag," say he got my cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaPlante?  Ha!  Which version?  This bozo has more stories than a newspaper.  In one of them, he's "the angel of Flight 104!"  He pulls you off the plane, saves your purse for you, but forgets to return it. That's Version 63.  In Version 64, he kept it to pay for his "hundred dollar shoes." The guy's a bullshit artist, he's already got a sentence pending for dealing stolen goods. (leaning forward, whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I know.  this is pretty off the wall... that guy, the hero, Bubber...  he was a homeless guy, right?  Down on his luck?  He couldn't have swiped the wallet, could he?  While he was rescuing you?  And sold it to this guy LaPlante?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raised eyebrows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Bubber risks his life to save me and fifty-four other people and...  swipes my purse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too far-fetched?  I mean, I'm not trying to make problems for John Bubber, I just want to make sure this creep LaPlante does some meaningful time.  If we can't figure out how he got the cards, it makes it more difficult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me more about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY is sprawled on the living room floor, surrounded by homework, his eyes on the TV set. EVELYN, on the sofa, looks up from her book and catches J watching the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homework.  You're doing homework, remember? The phone rings and EVELYN gets up and goes for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homework, homework, homework!  No homework, no zoo trips, no movies. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (then, very cold...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing his homework. JOEY looks up from his homework.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE is talking into the phone urgently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm going away, I just wanna say goodbye to... never mind where. I just wanna say... He can't call me back later, my phone's disconnected...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVELYN covers the mouthpiece and turns to JOEY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your father.  If you don't talk to him, he's going to call all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Joey, how ya doin', pal, it's me.  Your old man.  You get the twenty dollars?  What? (listens...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she's right on that, Joey, that's the best place for it, a college fund.  I was gonna tell ya that myself.  Look, about how I didn't show up the other night I... what? (he listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen me out the window.... (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One shoe, yeah and the mud...  So you thought I mighta been the heroic guy, huh? (a beat, then...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' what'd she say when you...? "Against my religion," huh? (he struggles, then... decisive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know Joey, this kinda stuff, we gotta talk about it some time, man to man.  But I gotta go off on this -- this damn business trip now...  for a while.  So... so I won't be seein' you.  What you gotta do, you gotta listen to your mother, she's smart, very smart, knows what's best for you and... (reacting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, it ain't 'cause I don't like you, Christ!  I mean, not "Christ," you know... I mean I don't wanna go on this business thing, I love you Joey, but I gotta! That's part of growing older, all these goddamn (pardon the vulgarity) business things you have to do.  Which reminds me, this "hero" business... one of the things you learn as you get older is that life gets very complicated... weird actually... people aren't exactly like they seem...  nothing is...  life gets unbelievable... this is normal as you grow older and...  huh?  I was talking to Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your son actually wants to spend time with you.  If you let him down this time after popping back into his life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ev, you gotta understand, it's this...  this goddamn business trip, no wait, don't hang up, Ev, just a sec, listen, I just wanna say one thing, okay?  One thing! (with some effort)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I kinda act like an asshole sometimes.  I know that.  I know you were a good wife.  I know I fucked it up.  I had a good thing an' I blew it.  I just want you to know I know that, okay?  I gotta go now.  Business trip.  It's gonna be a while. BERNIE hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVELYN stares at the phone as though it had changed into of fruit before her eyes!  Bernie said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINSTON (who bought Bernie's TV) has opened his door just crack to address GALE and CHUCKY.  It says "Manager" on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaPlante!  That asshole!  I don't... Hey, is that you, from the tee vee? In person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from Channel Four, yes.  We'd like to find --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "This is Gale Gayley for Channel Four News!"  Incredible. Unbelievable!  For Bernie LaPlante! He's a celebrity now?  'Cause he stole paint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We couldn't find his name on the buzzer or on the mailbox, but... WINSTON pushes past them out the, door and into the corri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Low profile."  That's his big motto!  He don't put his name on anything.  Come on, we'll go look. GALE sees WINSTON trundling down the corridor toward the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINSTON waddles up the stairs with GALE and CHUCKY on his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we have buzzed him to let him know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the time he don't answer even if he's home.  Know why?  'Cause he don't want no bill collectors to find him.  I don't mean to be judgmental, but he's a scumbag. He don't have no friends.  Who's gonna like a creep like LaPlante? I was doin' him a favor on the TV outta kindness, and he screwed me. You know what color skin you get on my set, Miss Gayley?  Purple! That's what color skin you got on the tee vee LaPlante sells me! During the climb, GALE'S BEEPER goes off.  She shuts it o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!  BANG!  BANG!  WINSTON pounds on the door to 5A whi and CHUCKY hover behind him anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard!  Bernard!  Hey, LaPlante, open the door.  Television Interview!  Fame and fortune.  Open up, Bernard. WINSTON pulls a ring of keys from his belt and unlocks th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope the silly bastard didn't kill himself.  He's all upset about this sentence he got.  He's going to prison. (to Chucky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a camera you're carrying?  If he killed himself, you could take pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINSTON, GALE and CHUCKY enter the tiny charmless living As WINSTON disappears into the bedroom; GALE glances arou notices something. A cheap commercial photo of BERNIE with JOEY at the zoo. Studying it, she considers BERNIE'S face. WINSTON re-enters from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dead body.  Too bad.  Not too often you guys get pictures of a body even before the cops get there. Exclusive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if you'd mind if we waited for him here, Mister Winston... Surprised, CHUCKY gives her a sharp look, like "what's up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he gonna do, sue?  You people, you're the media. WINSTON exits, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna wait here?  The guy could be hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe, maybe not.  I have a feeling this guy is important somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, great that you're a career-fiend, I got a wife and family, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky, Chucky, you... OW! GALE has flopped down on BERNIE'S ratty sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sofa is a lethal weapon.  The springs... are... the springs... what...? GALE is digging behind her on the sofa.  She pulls out Th silver Mike Award and stares at it, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The...Silver...Mike...Award!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy LaPlante won an award?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at the inscription)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "For Excellence in the Pursuit of Truth."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaPlante!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?  What's goin' on here? BERNIE is standing in the doorway, scowling at CHUCKY.  B before the astonished CHUCKY can respond, GALE turns, rev her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera, Chucky.  Are you Bernard LaPlante, sir?  What is your relationship with John Bubber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating chucky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn that thing off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up the Silver Mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you acquire this, Mister LaPlante?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do ya think I got it, for Chrissake? (to Chucky, indicating the vidpak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, put that thing down.  This is my goddamn apartment, you can't just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your scheme, Mister LaPlante? What are you forcing John Bubber to do?  What are you -- ? The door bursts open and WINSTON rushes in hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen!

dialogues.speaker: TV IMAGE, (EXT. DRAKE HOTEL - P.O.V. OF LEDGE - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: Weirdly distorted colors.  A shaky long lens shot (news c reveals a bright green BUBBER standing on a ledge fifteen stories up while a REPORTER narrates urgently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- say that they cannot rig a net below him because they are afraid it will trigger his decision to jump.  Bubber has said repeatedly he will only talk with Gale Gayley a local television reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where GALE, flanked by BERNIE, CHUCKY, and WINSTON, is st in horror at the lurid color image on the TV BERNIE sold WINSTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far, attempts to reach Ms. Gayley have not succeeded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Winston)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your phone!  Quick. As WINSTON shows her the phone, BERNIE scowls at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's green for Chrissake! As GALE punches digits on the phone, WINSTON turns back t BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit!  You took advantage of me, LaPlante.  It's a piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta tune it, ya bozo.  You gotta adjust it. BERNIE is adjusting the television color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, as you can see, a crowd has gathered here at the hotel, many of them in tears, pleading aloud with John Bubber not to jump.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: speaking urgently and privately into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, tell him I'm on my way. (she slams down the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Chucky.  A police escort is gonna pick us up en route.  You too, LaPlante.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not in the car in ten seconds, I'll have the cops pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops!  What kinda bullshit is this?  Is this America or -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent, inspiration)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!  Here... ten, thirty, fifty bucks.  How much have you got, Chucky?  Give Mister LaPlante your money. GALE shoves cash into BERNIE'S hands as CHUCKY obediently reaches for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Let's go!  John's in danger. Confused, BERNIE looks at the cash, then follows them out door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pocketing the cash)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, you media people think you can just buy people.  Cheap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS SCREAM.  An escort of POLICE MOTORCYCLES precedes speeding Channel Four van through the dark streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCKY is at the wheel of the van, GALE beside him.  BERN back in the confusion of equipment and monitors that show news coverage of Bubber on the ledge.  BERNIE is addressi indignantly, trying to be heard over the SCREAMING of the SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fault!  My fault!  This nut case goes out on a ledge and it's my fault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything happens to John BUbber, Mister LaPlante I'm going to see you prosecuted to the full extent of the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, is everybody in love with this, bozo?  I don't get this.  What about...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, everybody is in love with John Bubber.  The whole country, in fact. And they're not going to be happy if he jumps to his death because he was harassed by a lousy little money-grubbing low-life fence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Harassed."  Cause I yelled at him when he's riding in his limo?  The guy's a thief, he took my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (erupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had one tiny, uncharacteristic moment of weakness.  That's not the same thing as a lifetime of petty crime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stung)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, lady, I got faults, I know I'm not perfect but I don't get this at all, your attitude.  I saved your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lifetime of petty crime climaxed by your sleaziest accomplishment yet...  blackmailing a national hero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- saved your...  whaaaaaaat?  What? Blackmailing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I haven't figured it out? Just because the cops aren't on to you yet doesn't mean you're home free.  I'm a veteran reporter.  I've seen your kind before, the underbelly of crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underbelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all that smoke and fire, John had a moment of weakness.  He'd been down and out, destitute, living in his car.  It was just an impulse, stealing my purse. BERNIE looks thunderstruck.  CHUCKY too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swiped your purse!  While he was saving you?  You gotta be kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a triumphant 190k at Bernie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sold it to Mister LaPlante, the fence, who's now trying to blackmail poor John. BERNIE is too stunned to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotta be a nut!  He saves all those people and swipes a purse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he was a real hero, Chucky. He was acting out of a deep instinctive decency, not out of some ego thing.  He didn't expect the media to lionize him.  He didn't expect a million dollar reward. He saved fifty-four people because something inside him, some fundamental love for his fellow man, made him rush into that plane when "good sense" told him otherwise. He was willing to settle for some credit cards he sold to LaPlante.... (to Bernie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how much, LaPlante?  A couple of bucks?  Did you give him enough for a decent meal? BERNIE, who's been listening to the description of his ow with slack-jawed amazement, is too taken aback to answer. The van zips past dark city streets populated by DERELICT HOMELESS PEOPLE as GALE continues her emotional outpourin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this is off the record, Chucky, because if John Bubber lives, Mister LaPlante is going to give him his assurance that there will be no more "misbehavior" on his part.  What's more he's going to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to apologize to Bubber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could deny I had those credit cards on the plane with me, LaPlante...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie, you mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I wouldn't lie...but I could tell the story the way I did just now, so that people could understand that John is even more of a hero, and that you... you're the lowest thing that ever crawled.  Your name will be synonymous with cynical opportunism and blackmail.  You won't get a cent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a kid, you know.  I'm a person, for Chrissake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for your child's sake, show some decency then, rise above your sleazy instincts. (a sob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may have already killed him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE buck the tide of the excited CROWD, making a wedge get GALE, CHUCKY, and BERNIE to the hotel entrance.  A CO BERNIE, thinking him a spectator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  He's with us, Officer. REPORTERS, on the fringe of the crowd, address their came

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police are escorting Reporter Gale Gayley to the fifteenth floor where she will be able to talk to Bubber.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: A tiny figure on a narrow ledge fifteen floors up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALE rushes into the suite now jammed with POLICE, FIREME DIGNITARIES and heads straight for the open window, dragg BERNIE with her.  CHUCKY follows, Vidcam raised. At the window she encounters the POLICE CHIEF and a PRIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll only talk to you, Ms Gayley. Just lean out and we'll hold you from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone on the ledge twenty feet from the open window, BUBB looking down at the CROWD below.  They're chanting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John!  Don't do it!  Everything's okay. BUBBER has tears in his eyes.  He turns at the sound of G voice and sees her leaning out the window, calling to him Pulling an envelope from his pocket, BUBBER moves a coupl steps toward GALE and bends down to place the envelope on ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale!  This is for you.  I want you to know I never meant to hurt you. This will explain everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I know all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Straightening up, he... LOSES HIS BALANCE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, John!  It's nothing! A little mistake.  Everybody will understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A little mistake"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, John, you're too hard on yourself.  I've got the creep here, the guy who's... GALE breaks off as BERNIE suddenly shoulders his way to t window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!  Hold on!  Lemme talk to him for Chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE pushes past the astonished GALE and scrambles awkw out onto' the ledge, kicking back at the FIREMEN who grab ankles until...

dialogues.speaker: FIREMEN
dialogues.text: exchanging a look, the FIREMEN realize their efforts are likely to knock BERNIE off than save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER stares in amazement as BERNIE emerges onto the led all fours, yelling toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bubber, c'mere!  I gotta talk to you, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaPlante!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, John, don't be an asshole. I don't like heights. Hastily, BUBBER backs further from the window (and the en lying on the ledge).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, LaPlante, I'm really sorry. It's all in my letter to Ga... uh, Miss Gayley.  I was all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCKY is wedged beside GALE in the window, pointing his at BERNIE'S ass.  Suddenly BERNIE sees BUBBER looking pas at the cameras and, turning awkwardly, he snaps at GALE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn that thing off!  You want him to jump? GALE and the OTHERS step back from the window hastily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE turns back to BUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna talk with you for a minute.  Then you can jump.  You can jump twice for all I care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk from there.  You can talk from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In private.  They got cameras and alla that crap in there. Microphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather than leaning out the window, GALE and OTHERS in th are following the drama on the TV monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONKLIN narrates while the SHAKY CAMERA FOCUSES on BERNIE BUBBER who are continuing to argue on the ledge, BERNIE motioning for BUBBER to come closer, BUBBER resisting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like someone is out on the ledge with John Bubber.  We can only presume this is a rescue specialist of some kind from the police or fire department. (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... he's moving toward Bubber, crawling.  He does not appear to have a safety rope tied to him and, as we've explained, the fire department has been unable to rig a net.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO GALE
dialogues.text: Ironically, she's "seeing the events" happening fifteen f from her on a monitor showing...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV SCREEN, (EXT. HOTEL - P.O.V. OF LEDGE - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: a camera angle fifteen stories below, a SHAKY ZOOM attemp to isolate BERNIE on the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face shows surprise at BERNIE'S courage.  Did she mis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inching forward, BERNIE is just reaching the letter BUBBE on the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the letter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for Ga... Ms. Gayley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I, a goddamn postman?  I'm way the fuck up here, I'm scared a heights, and you want me to deliver a letter?  Put a stamp on it for Chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's close enough.  It's a confession.  The truth.  Jesus, I'm sorry, LaPlante.  I had the shoe, you said you didn't want, publicity because of your legal problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't recall saying I didn't want a million bucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never really thought they'd go for it.  And then... you didn't come forward, they investigated my war record...  I kept expecting you to show up and expose me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in the can, for Chrissake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom!  For two days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jail!  Listen, Bubber... (looks down, fifteen stories)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy.  We could fall off of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go in.  You're risking your life again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweating, trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to... be aware of that, John.  Listen, I'm not gonna do nothing heroic here, you can trust me on that, buddy.  Whaddaya say we just sit down for a while. I don't have no tricks, I'm not that smart.  You could, like, rest up for the jump. BUBBER considers the situation, relaxes, lowers himself t he's sitting beside BERNIE.  Then he helps BERNIE off his into a sitting position so they're sitting side by side o ledge.  BUBBER shakes his head sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done?  I was dirt poor and useless... but I was honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up, John.  You think you got problems for Chrissake? BERNIE wipes the sweat from his forehead, unaware that he smearing his face with black soot from the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the hotel in the midst of the confusion of em vehicles, POLICE, and ONLOOKERS, a cherry-picker has arri and a TV CAMERAMAN from Channel 4 is riding in the rising pulpit.

dialogues.speaker: TELEVISION IMAGE, (EXT. DRAKE HOTEL P.O.V. - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: A shaky long lens shot from fifteen stories below shows B sitting beside BUBBER on the ledge while the REPORTER nar urgently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- still don't know why John BUbber, hero to the nation, stepped out onto the ledge fifteen stories above the street more than an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY, wearing pajamas and headphones, is staring breathle at the TV from the bed in his darkened bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we now have the identity of the man who has been talking to him for the last fifteen minutes at great personal risk.  He has been identified as Bernard LaPlante, former employee of Gumley's Carpet Care.

dialogues.speaker: JOEY
dialogues.text: JOEY'S jaw sags and he sits up in bed as the REPORTER con on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TELEVISION SCREEN, (EXT. LEDGE FROM BELOW - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: the lens ZOOMS TIGHTER, and therefore SHAKIER, offering a image in which BUBBER and BERNIE are semi-identifiable as sit on the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is speculation that LaPlante is an old friend of Bubber's, perhaps a war buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOEY has already sprinted out of the room, leaving the TV playing to his empty bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALE is giving way at the window to CHUCKY who's leaning to try and get a shot.  Jammed in by the CROWD, her view blocked, she glimpses a TV monitor nearby.

dialogues.speaker: TV MONITOR/VIDEO IMAGE, (EXT. LEDGE - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: The SHAKY CLOSE-UP of BERNIE'S face, smeared with soot, f the screen.  The angle is very reminiscent of the glimpse got of BERNIE in the crashed plane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arc light is switched on, lighting up BERNIE'S face.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO GALE,
dialogues.text: stunned.  Just then CHUCKY taps her on his way out of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna grab the high ground, get a hot overhead angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotlights illuminate BERNIE and BUBBER as they sit on th and converse, like a couple of guys on a park bench somew oblivious to the CROWD below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flabbergasted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole her purse!  While you were saving her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big deal?  You decided to pretend you were me.  A little moment of weakness, right?  So I sorta swiped her purse.  I got feet of clay too, bUddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she thinks you're blackmailing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. BUBBER actually sees humor in this, but BERNIE is thinkin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which don't sound like such a bad goddamn idea, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Whadda you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we gotta work this thing out, John.  It's a goddamn mess an' I'm halfway to doing serious time in the joint an' the TV lady's so stuck on you she don't want it to come out you stole her purse because it might break the heart of millions. (indicating the chanting crowd below)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looka those maniacs, willya?  They love you, for Chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to be a hero, LaPlante, but I can't face people... the looks in their eyes... after the trust they gave me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!  You make this big goddamn mess, then ya jump.  Beautiful! Listen, John, I was there at the hospital today, I seen you with those little bastards (pardon my vulgarity).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you!  I thought I heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying I hate sick people or anything but I hate being around them if you know what I mean.  There you go, you inspire this kid to live.  I probably woulda vomited on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allen?  He... he's okay? BUBBBR is visibly affected by the news about ALLEN but BE doesn't notice, rattles on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what I mean?  You remember his name for Chrissake!  I mean, I remember my own kid's name... but I'm always forgetting his birthday. Plus when they stick cameras in your face and ask all these stupid questions, you smile at them.  You got a kinda...  a kinda... "gift," there, John, if ya know what I mean. People wanna be saved by you.  Even me!  If I was gonna be saved I wouldn't wanna see Bernie LaPlante comin' outta the goddamn smoke an' darkness an' fear an' stuff.  I'd wanna see John God Damn Bubber! BUBBER is moved... but still has doubts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got those people out of the plane, LaPlante, not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You woulda gone in there, you wouldn'ta thought twice...  Trust me on that, that's the kinda guy you are.  For a guy like me, it's a momentary loss of sanity.  I wasn't thinking clearly.  Listen, I'm no hero, John.  I just want some dough and maybe a little favor. How much didja spend already on all that do-gooder bullshit?  You didn't spend it all didja?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I donated a lot to different causes, uh... La...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie.  Call me Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --but there's a lot of it still left, uh, Bernie.  Almost half. BERNIE'S eyes glitter with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several monitors show a variety of coverage of the drama ledge on their screens while, nearby, WALLACE hovers anxi over DEAKINS' shoulder as DEAKINS rants into the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddaya mean what do I wanna know? I wanna know everything.  Who's this screwball LaPlante for Pete's sake, what the hell's he doing out there, auditioning for the priesthood? You're supposed to be on top of this, Gale, don't... (he stops, listens, explodes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Quit!"  You can't quit!  It's unprofessional!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit?  She wants to quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Wallace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Gale, I know you're emotionally involved.  Don't be emotionally involved, be professional. (listens, then...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Gale, you are not a hardbitten, cynical hard-ass, you just think you are.  You are a goddamn cream puff!  Try and be a hard-ass! DEAKINS hangs up the phone angrily and faces WALLACE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVELYN is staring dumbfounded at the TV screen, the volum now, no longer coming through the headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!  It... it is him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh-why's he... why's he up there, mom? EVELYN looks pale and stricken.  Instead of answering, sh a decision...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your coat?  Get your coat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAKINS and WALLACE are watching a CHANNEL EIGHT REPORTER one of the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just learned that LaPlante is a convicted felon due to be sentenced tomorrow for trafficking in stolen goods.  According to our sources, LaPlante knowingly purchased twelve cases of stolen latex paint which he subsequently sold to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale shoulda aired that bit first, she's the one who found this clown LaPlante!  She let Channel Eight get a beat on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Deak, what if Bubber has got something to hide?  What if he's the wrong guy, not really the hero...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly firm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Deak, not a great story.  We backed this guy, he's our boy!  We gave him a vote of confidence, we gave him a million dollars. DEAKINS is chastened.  He "gets it."  Just then, exciteme the Channel Four monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's going on, Bubber is communicating something.  Both men are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excitement in the CROWD, looking up, yelling.  Something' happening.  CONKLIN is speaking into his mike even as the of the CROWD engulfs him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- still sitting on the ledge but Bubber is motioning to someone in the window, he seems to be calling out to them and now... now he's holding up two fingers.  He's signalling something, holding up two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Ford station wagon speeds toward the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVELYN is at the wheel, JOEY beside her, the RADIO on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I gave you the impression I hated him I didn't mean to.  I... I hate the way he behaves... he's selfish and self-centered and cynical...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's "cynical"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's when you say, "Everybody else cheats why shouldn't I?" (emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't -- I don't hate -- him. I... loved him once, Joey.  Very much.  I just got... tired.  Maybe it wasn't all his fault.  He... What's happening?  Oh, my God... EVELYN is reacting to the live radio broadcast, a sudden in the REPORTER'S VOICE, CROWD SOUNDS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?  What are they doing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: HAVE A REPORT HERE...
dialogues.text: EVELYN and JOEY are breathless, mesmerized, waiting to he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
