dialogues.text: Coffee!  Just like your father to request something totally inappropriate.  Thousands of people watching and he wants a cup of coffee. (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when you were in the hospital, when you had the appendicitis, your father stayed all night by your bed... and he hates hospitals, always thinks he's going to catch something... and then that time when your Uncle Howard got hurt... It seems like your father is at his best in a crisis... when things go really wrong or there's some kind of emergency, your father forgets to be Bernie LaPlante and acts sort of like... a human being. There are tears in her eyes as she drives.  The RADIO con

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've learned that the devices the firemen used to "deliver" the coffee... I described them as "poles"... are, in fact, oversized tongs used by the hotel staff to change difficult-to-reach lightbulbs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE and BUBBER are distant figures sitting on a ledge it was a park bench, sipping coffee and visibly negotiati in a pantomime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer now, we can hear BERNIE and BUBBER wrapping up the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it?  Four year scholarship to a top college, plus Medical School or Law School or whatever Joey wants; pay off the $2,500 to my attorney, plus pay her fee in full, plus my annual consulting fee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And give a deposition to the jUdge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sudden thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, John, you better double my attorney's fee.  She's very inexperienced, but she done a great job for me. And give her your autograph.  She thinks you're some kinda holy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the deposition for the jUdge, Bernie... I mean there's no way I can promise anything.  I can't tell him what we're up to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll tell him I talked you out of jumping, right?  Just keep me outta prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'll do the best I can, Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good enough for me.  You better take that "letter" there and get rid of it. BERNIE indicates the envelope on the ledge and BUBBER sli the envelope into his pocket surreptitiously. BERNIE and BUBBER are shaking hands.  Then they start to cautiously to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALE is watching the action on a TV monitor, trying to fi out what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE and BUBBER are shaking hands.  Then they start to cautiously to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD reacts to the action on the ledge while TV REPO including CONKLIN chatter into their mikes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting to their feet. They're standing up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE is on his feet, unsteady, terrified of the drop. BUBBER, much more graceful, not as wobbly, is speaking to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what I did, how do you know I'll come through?  How do you know you can trust me? Shakily, BERNIE indicates the CROWD far below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause, bottom line, John, I ain't no different than all those dumb assholes down there.  We all trust you for Chrissake!  We... ANGLE ON THE DROP/BERNIE'S P.O.V. Straight down, fifteen floors.  A CROWD of "ants."  Firet Police cars, TV vans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly BERNIE starts shaking like a leaf, trying to sme body against the side of the building as he inches along narrow ledge toward the window with BUBBER right behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Th-this was really dumb, coming out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the CROWD looks up breathlessly, WE DISCOVER EVELYN pu JOEY through the CROWD toward the hotel steps, their eyes BERNIE and BUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCKY is cautiously moving under the neon sign on the ro first on all fours, then on his belly, moving toward the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER is steering BERNIE toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow and easy, Bernie. BERNIE takes a cautious step.  BUBBER tries to distract B from the drop by talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What made you do it, Bernie?  Go in the plane? Another cautious step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.  It was... an impulse. Me, wearing my good shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same with me, pretending I was you. An impulse.  Why not?  I had this shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this kid there saying, "Go in there and save my father, mister." And I'm thinking about my boy Joey and this goddamn fireman my wife's seeing. It was like I was supposed to save myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and with me it was like I was supposed to pretend the shoe was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you gotta wear it, you poor bastard.  Everyday you gotta be everybody's hero.  People watching you all the time.  Waiting for you to make...  a slip.  Slip up. BERNIE glances down to indicate the CROWD and... takes a misstep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single audible gasp from the CROWD below as BERNIE, fif stories up, staggers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE struggles to regain his balance. BUBBER reaches out to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy does it, partner.  It's gonna be fine. BUBBER'S hand remains on BERNIE'S shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Watching from the window, holding her breath.  Is it poss he's going to push BERNIE?  What an opportunity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER'S hand on BERNIE'S shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Sweating, pushing his foot cautiously forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look down.  Keep your eyes... BERNIE looks down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHHHHHHHH!  He sees the tiny PEOPLE below and he STARTS FALL.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Wobbling unsteadily, arms flailing, falling.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: His eyes!  He's looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees BERNIE clutching the ledge with one hand, looking at him with pleading eyes as he dangles fifteen stories a the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: It's slipping!  He can't hold!

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER'S EYES
dialogues.text: staring at BERNIE'S hand.  It must occur to him that life be better without BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: watching from the window, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVELYN and JOEY are looking up, love and fear in their ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  Bernie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIREMAN is leaning out the window, reaching for BUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in here, buddy.  You can't help him.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: Slipping.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: BUBBER is looking into BERNIE'S eyes as BERNIE'S hand sli

dialogues.speaker: THE FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Leaning out the window, holding a rescue noose toward BUB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't reach out.  He'll pull you over!

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: BUBBER ignores the FIREMAN, his hand reaching out toward BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaching out to grab BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALLACE screams at the TV set.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: reacting, head out the window...

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Reaching a NOOSE-DEVICE toward BUBBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab this!  Now!  Save yourself, you can't help him, he'll pull you over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER is sitting, bracing himself.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: His hand slipping, his eyes full of fear.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: reacting.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: losing his grip... when BUBBER'S HAND suddenly grabs his

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Looking up into BUBBER'S eyes.  Their eyes lock.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: Holding BERNIE with great effort.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIREMAN
dialogues.text: rescue noose in hand, crawling out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna put this line around you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining, indicates BERNIE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put...the...line...on...him. BUBBER leans back against the building, struggling to kee BERNIE from plummeting fifteen stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't hold him, he's gonna pull you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he doesn't make it... I... don't...  make it.  Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir!  I got it!  Loud and clear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCKY has bellied out on the roof under the big neon sig he's pointing his camera straight down at the drama below he mutters under his breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his narrator voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zooming in tighter yet, he captures the stark drama at great personal risk. (humbly responding to an imaginary interviewer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Was I afraid?  Well, you don't think about yourself at moments like that.  You think about the f-stop, you think about focus, you think about the 11 o'clock news, everybody counting on you."

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO IMAGE, (EXT. HOTEL/STRAIGHT DOWN FROM ROOF - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: "CHUCKY'S SHOT" is a CLOSE UP of BERNIE'S desperate face straight up, the enormous drop in the background. A MONTAGE of different locations and TV sets featuring Ch CLOSE-UP of BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHICK stares at the screen incredulously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie?  Bernie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television set shows the drama in garish otherworldly as WINSTON mutters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaPlante, you crazy bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunned DONNA is in bed with her BOYFRIEND, stares at t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's one of your clients?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUDGE GOINES frowns at the TV set, tries to place that na

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LaPlante.  Mmmmmmmm.  LaPlante.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO IMAGE, (EXT. HOTEL/LOW ANGLE LOOKING UP AT BUBBER)
dialogues.text: On the TV screen, a low shot looking up at BUBBER straini hold on to BERNIE replaces "CHUCKY'S ANGLE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO FIREMEN have almost secured a rope around BERNIE whil BUBBER continues to hang on to BERNIE, speaking to him th gritted teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking... good, partner.  Hang in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eye contact)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-you're a g-god damn saint, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suite is jammed with MEDIA PERSONNEL, many standing o sofas, tables, and chairs, all of them (and their cameras focussed on JOHN BUBBER who's standing behind a bank of m making a "statement" that sounds sincere (perhaps because is halting, awkward, painful...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a moment of terrible weakness.  I was feeling... I guess you'd call it "overwhelmed" by all the pressures and... the expectations of... fame... celebrity.  I just didn't feel... adequate... to everybody's image of me... so... I took my despair out on that ledge with the intention of...  jumping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a collective reaction, breathless silence.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: jammed among REPORTERS near the bedroom door, her eyes on BUBBER, frowning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In doing that I endangered the lives of hardworking policemen and firemen who attempted to rescue me, not to mention the life of my dear friend, Bernard LaPlante... BUBBER pauses and the room erupts in a chorus of REPORTER VOICES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is Bernard LaPlante?  Did you know that LaPlante is a convicted criminal?  What is your relationship with Bernard LaPlante...?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: glancing at the bedroom door guarded by a UNIFORMED COP.

dialogues.speaker: BUBBER
dialogues.text: taking a deep breath, answering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernard LaPlante is a close friend who came to me in a time of need... at considerable risk to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUBBER is continuing on the TV set in the bedroom while B all alone in the huge bedroom, stares at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Bernie's made some mistakes.  I know I've made plenty myself.  In fact I don't know anyone who hasn't.  I think Bernie wants to be a private person and I I'm going to respect that.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: glances idly at the TV remote control... and pockets it a automatically, still watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV, (INT. SUITE/HOTEL - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: REPORTERS erupt again in a CACOPHONY of QUESTIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say to you?  What'd you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what he said to me was private.  But he gave me confidence in myself.  He told me I had a special opportunity, the chance to do some good in the world.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: He raises his eyebrows.  I said that?  On impulse, he pul the remote from his pocket to return it.  He's setting it when he turns suddenly to find he's not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  How'd you get in?  Nobody's supposed to come in here! GALE has just entered the room.  Did she see his action?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I snuck in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You media people, you think you can just go anywhere you want, spy on people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Mister LaPlante... uh, Bernie... Who... are... you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I?  You're asking me?  You're the big expert for Chrissake!  I'm what?  The "Scumbag," right?  The sleazebag something or other, the blackmailer, the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it you?  In the plane?  Who saved my life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Listen, I don't give no interviews.  That was John Bubber. You wanna ask me questions, you could talk to my attorney, Miss O'Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imploring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister LaPlante... Bernie... I... just for a few moments... I want to be a human being, not a reporter. I'm somebody who was going to die in a burning plane and I looked up, and some man came out of the smoke, his face smeared with mud, and soot and... and he... saved my... life. Off the record.  Was it you?  Why would you deny it if it was? Because you took my purse?  Why? BERNIE looks at GALE.  She looks very human, very real, t reporter's veneer completely gone!  He hesitates.  How ca not tell the truth at a moment like this?  He takes a dee breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, do I look dumb enough to run into a burning plane and save a bunch of strangers?  I ain't the type. GALE stares at him.  BERNIE tries to hold her look, darin to doubt him.  But he can't.  His eyes "run."  He's not a liar this time.  But just then CONKLIN'S VOICE on the TV Evelyn's name distracts BERNIE.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN, (INT. LOBBY/HOTEL - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: CONKLIN is hovering over EVELYN and JOEY who are standing a pool of TV lights while a CROWD presses close around th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- standing here in the lobby of the hotel with Evelyn LaPlante who says she is the wife of the mysterious Bernie LaPlante who was rescued from a fifteenth story ledge twenty minutes ago by John Bubber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!  Ev!  Joey!  For Chrissake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. LaPlante just told me that Bernard LaPLante spoke to her earlier today about "going away on a long trip" and wanting to say "goodbye" to his ten-year-old son, Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know Bernie'd try and jump off a building.  I didn't understand.  I just thought he was up to his old... I mean, I didn't even know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV!  Christ Almighty!  You cannot believe one word on TV!  Not one goddamn word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of man is your ex-husband Mrs. LaPlante?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bursting into sobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie LaPlante is a wonderful decent human being.  Deep down. You just have to know him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all bullshit!  I swear to God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you love your father too, Joey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my dad's great.  He took me to the zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big love)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you feel, Joey, seeing your father up there on that ledge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared but... but... but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I knew John Bubber would save him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos.  BUBBER is trying to get to the bedroom door, the conference over, but he's being mobbed by MEDIA PERSONNEL are SCREAMING questions, scrambling over furniture, block his path, jamming CAMERAS and MIKES in his face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you afraid?  Look this way, John.  John, over here.  Mister Bubber, do you believe in God? BUBBER is struggling toward the bedroom door when he HEAR VOICE cutting through the other VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Bubber!  Mister Bubber!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: BUBBER turns, sees GALE through a "forest" of heads.  The eyes meet, she shouts a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Bubber... how does a person know when he's a hero... and when he's not. Their eyes are locked, as if they're the only two in this crowded room.  A private question in a public place.  The becomes quiet as everyone realizes BUBBER is going to res BUBBER speaks soberly, directly to GALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, like.  I said, Miss... uh, Gale, I think we're all heroes. If you catch us at the right moment.  We all have something noble and decent in us trying to get out... and we all have moments of weakness. GALE'S eyes are locked with his as he continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAKINS and WALLACE are watching BUBBER continue on their monitor.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN, (INT. HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT)
dialogues.text: BUBBER continues to CAMERA, GALE off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the media that notices one moment and one person and not another.  I'm just another human being like the next person, full of frailty with some courage and decency mixed in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a crock of shit!  Have you ever heard more bullshit and drivel from somebody who wasn't President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not unthinkable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Presidency.  The public loves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For ten more minutes they love him, Wally.  I'm sick of him and I'm always about ten minutes ahead of the public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "public" of MONKEYS clap hands, applauding a MONKEY who making a "speech."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BERNIE and JOEY appear, passing in front of the monkey ca deep in conversation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember where I said how I was gonna explain about life, buddy?  Well, the thing about life is...  it gets weird.  See people are always gonna be talking to you about "truth." Everybody always knows what the truth is, like it was toilet paper or something and they got a supply in the closet. But what you learn as you get older is, there ain't no truth. All there is is bullshit (pardon my vulgarity here).  Layers of it. One layer of bullshit on top of another.  So what you do in life, like when you get older, is you pick the layer of bullshit you prefer and that's your bullshit, so to speak.  You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally confounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm.  Well, it's complicated. Maybe when you're older.  Anyhow, what I'm gonna tell you here is in strict confidence, okay?  It don't go no further.  What happened is, you remember that night I was gonna take you to the movies an' it was raining like a sonofabitch, (there's gonna be some vulgarities)..? BERNIE puts an affectionate arm around JOEY'S shoulder as NOTICE that BERNIE is wearing brand new shiny shoes very like his former good shoes, but different colors.  As he JOEY walk off, BERNIE still talking, JOEY puts an arm aro his father and an audience of MONKEYS fills the foregroun MONKEYS.
